actionUnits.condition: OnTriggerEnter of DoorOpenScript (MonoBehaviour with m_Script.guid=5f8d06fe579502c4496842932d0afead; this MonoBehaviour block is the serialized settings of the attached script) on GameObject 'collider_porte' is fired by the grabbed object 'Cube_salle1' (id=816818218) that compares tag 'Objet1' true and has SnapToTrigger attached (MonoBehaviour with m_Script.guid=2723dba42bd113044ad231906b498006; this MonoBehaviour block is the serialized settings of the SnapToTrigger script). Scene meta shows DoorOpenScript.openTrigger=1 (true) and myDoor is currently unassigned (myDoor.fileID=0). Expected behavior: DoorOpenScript calls other.GetComponent<SnapToTrigger>().Snap(transform.position), attempts myDoor.Play('DoorOpen',0,0.0), sets collider_porte inactive, and sets openTrigger=false.

Retry triggering after previous Trigger in same run. Postconditions from prior step: collider_porte was SetActive(false) and DoorOpenScript.openTrigger has been set to false. Expect OnTriggerEnter to not fire or produce no effect (no Snap, no Animator.Play).

Fresh scene/reset state required: collider_porte active, DoorOpenScript.openTrigger=1. OnTriggerEnter fired by 'palteforme_cube' (id=546628669) which has tag 'Objet1' but no SnapToTrigger component (per scene meta). DoorOpenScript will pass CompareTag but snap will be null; calling snap.Snap(...) would raise a NullReferenceException. This covers the missing-component failure path. MonoBehaviour component with guid=5f8d06fe... is the DoorOpenScript settings that control this behavior.
